statement.p: Consider right triangle OPQ given in Figure, and assume that the length of the hypotenuse is OP = r for some constant r \gt 1. Let point M lie on \overline{OP} between O and P in such a way that OM = 1, and let point N lie on \overline{OQ} so that \angle ONM is a right angle, as pictured. In addition, assume that point O corresponds to (0,0), point Q to (x,0), and point P to (x,y) so that OQ = x and PQ = y. Finally, let \theta be the measure of \angle POQ.

figure.caption: Two right triangles \triangle OPQ and \triangle OMN.

li.p: Explain why \triangle OPQ and \triangle OMN are similar triangles.
What is the value of the ratio \frac{OP}{OM}? What does this tell you about the ratios \frac{OQ}{ON} and \frac{PQ}{MN}?
What is the value of ON in terms of \theta? What is the value of MN in terms of \theta?
Use your conclusions in (b) and (c) to express the values of x and y in terms of r and \theta.
